title: Hello World
description: Write a program that prints 'Hello, World!' to the standard output. This is the classic first program that every programmer writes when learning a new language.

title: Add Two Numbers
description: Write a program that reads two integers from standard input and prints their sum. The input will be given as two integers separated by a space on a single line.

title: Fibonacci Sequence
description: Write a program that calculates the nth number in the Fibonacci sequence. The Fibonacci sequence starts with 0 and 1, and each subsequent number is the sum of the two preceding ones. Your program should read an integer n from standard input and output the nth Fibonacci number (0-indexed).

title: Reverse String
description: Write a program that reads a string from standard input and prints it in reverse order. The input string may contain spaces and special characters. Do not reverse individual words, but the entire string.

title: Prime Number Checker
description: Write a program that determines whether a given positive integer is a prime number. A prime number is a natural number greater than 1 that has no positive divisors other than 1 and itself. Your program should read an integer from standard input and output 'Prime' if it's prime, or 'Not Prime' if it's not.
